sentences.en: Although much less experienced, he gave a good account of him self in the boxing match.
sentences.cn: 他虽然很缺乏经验， 但在拳击比赛中仍大显身手。

sentences.en: Boxing is a test of skill and technique, rather than brute strength.
sentences.cn: 拳击考验的是技能和技术，不是蛮力。

sentences.en: Boxing matches were very popular in England two hundred years ago.
sentences.cn: 两百年前拳击比赛在英国就很盛行.

sentences.en: He is an amateur in boxing.
He thinks boxing is good for kids, that it toughens them up.
sentences.cn: 他认为拳击对小孩子有好处，可使他们变得坚强。

sentences.en: He views boxing as his passport out of poverty.
sentences.cn: 他把拳击看作自己摆脱贫困的手段.

sentences.en: He wants to take on that boxing champion.
sentences.cn: 他想和那个拳击冠军较量。

sentences.en: He will never again be allowed inside a British boxing ring.
sentences.cn: 他被永久禁止踏入英国拳击赛场。

sentences.en: He's the king of unlicensed boxing.
His boxing career was ended after two sight-saving operations.
sentences.cn: 他的拳击生涯在两次视力救治手术之后终止了。

sentences.en: I think boxing will take off in a big way here.
sentences.cn: 我想拳击运动在这儿会有很大的发展。

sentences.en: I want to get boxing out of my system and settle down to enjoy family life.
sentences.cn: 我想结束拳击生涯，安定下来享受家庭生活。

sentences.en: One suspects he will be finished with boxing.
sentences.cn: 人们猜想他不会再打拳了。

sentences.en: She is expert at Chinese boxing.
Some speakers argued that boxing was less dangerous than rugby.
sentences.cn: 一些发言者认为拳击的危险性比橄榄球运动小。

sentences.en: That fellow is a promoter of boxing events.
sentences.cn: 那人是拳击比赛的赞助人.

sentences.en: They are promoting a boxing match.
sentences.cn: 他们正在筹划一次拳击比赛.

sentences.en: When he joined in the boxing I used to second him.
sentences.cn: 在他参加拳击比赛期间，我一直是他的拳击指导。

words.tran_cn: 拳击；[交]装箱；围模；[轻]做箱的材料

phrases.tran_cn: n. 节礼日；圣诞节后的第一个工作日
太极拳；拳坛暗影；拳击练习

trans.tran_en: the sport of fighting while wearing big leather  glove s
